Word

oblige (verb)

  • To oblige a person or entity to do something is to require or force them to do it, either because of a law or rule, or because it is necessary.
  • To simply oblige someone is to do them a favor.

â€œThe law obliges the government to release certain documents to the public.â€
â€œWhen my friend needed someone to taste test his new recipe for the cooking competition, I was happy to oblige.â€
